newsitem.title: USA: Montgomery, Ala., to sell $30 mln GO bond in May.
newsitem.headline: Montgomery, Ala., to sell $30 mln GO bond in May.

text.p: Montgomery, Ala., plans a $30 million of general obligation bond issue for schools and capital improvements in mid- to -late May, city Finance Director Sam Austin said Tuesday.
Stern, Agee & Leach Inc. is senior manager for the negotiated deal, with Frazier Lanier Co. Inc. and Thornton Farish Inc as co-managers.
The 20-year bonds are to be issued by the city under a joint agreement with Montgomery County and the county school board, with debt service repaid from sales tax revenues shared by the governments.
Austin said $19 million of bond proceeds will finance construction of two elementary schools and a middle school.
"The schools will then lease them from the city and operate the schools," Austin said.
When the bonds are retired, the city will sell the schools to the school board for $10.
The remaining $11 million of bond proceeds will be used for capital improvements for the city.
The plan still must be approved by the Montgomery City Commission, which is scheduled for a first reading Tuesday night.
"I expect it to pass," Austin said. "Building schools is not controversial."
"We're doing it this way because the school board came to the city and county and asked for help for construction of neighborhood schools," he said.
